alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 2:29AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern New Castle, northwestern Salem, northwestern Gloucester, southeastern Chester, southwestern Philadelphia and Delaware Counties through 300 AM EDT... At 228 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Penns Grove, or over Wilmington, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Wilmington, Chester, Deptford, West Deptford, Pennsville, Yeadon, Woodbury, Pitman, Carneys Point, Folcroft, Swarthmore, Elsmere, Paulsboro, New Castle, Penns Grove, Salem, Woodstown, Woodbury Heights and National Park. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 1 and 2. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 14. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 4 and 23. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 23. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
